amendment.description: Amendment provides authority for education coordinating councils to fund regional workshops for sharing information about the best techniques and the resources available for the teaching of mathematics and science and strengthening the ability to teach math and science, particularly in the elementary and secondary levels.
amendment.purpose: An amendment numbered 14 printed in House Report 109-399 provide authority for Mathematics and Science Education Coordinating Councils to support regional workshops designed to permit educators, administrators responsible for professional development and curriculum development, and faculty of teacher preparation programs to share successful research based strategies for improving student achievement in mathematics and science instruction in elementary and secondary schools.

vote.text: On agreeing to the Wilson (NM) amendment (A004) Agreed to by voice vote.
